Jonathan Chia Guangrong, Fund Manager at JCG FundLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 19 Feb 2019If your risk appetite is more conservative, consider the use of ssb or high yielding savings accounts like what Nicholas has mentioned. Alternative would be a fixed deposit. There are some promotions ongoing now for close to 2%.If you are more adventurous, consider buying into some s-reits, especially those who have good sponsors or those with consistent pay outs. Yield can be from 5% onwards. Downside is that there may be price fluctuations so you may realise a capital loss at the time you need to exit your position. 0 comments1
